alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 13 at 8:38AM EDT until April 13 at 9:30AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... South central Wakulla County in Big Bend of Florida... Northeastern Franklin County in Big Bend of Florida... * Until 930 AM EDT. * At 838 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 18 miles east of Carrabelle, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Wakulla and northeastern Franklin Counties, including the following locations... Alligator Point, Shell Point, Medart, Buckhorn, Bald Point, Panacea-Wakulla Airport, Spring Creek, Sopchoppy, Tully and Panacea. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
